Crossfire (the Minecraft map, not the board game whose 90â€™s commercial theme song somehow triggers in my head every time I see the word â€œCrossfireâ€) is a simple, but fast-paced PvP map. The arenas are small and intense, and each playerâ€™s crossbow can fire off a powerful shot capable of defeating enemies in a single hit. Watch the skies for periodic helicopter spawns; if you shoot one, you might find yourself with some powerful new loot.

Drycut Lanes
æ­»çš®å°å¾„

by Ty
ä½œè€…ï¼šTy




Drycut Lanes is a race for the wool (the Minecraft genre, not the popular game played in the fields of New Zealand) map in which teams race down their respective lanes, hunting for wool, then making it to the finish. As they hunt, players will need to adventure through underground secrets and survive through various themed areas, such as The Nether, andâ€¦ The End. Grab a friend â€“ or an enemy â€“ and have a blast as you compete to be the speediest and wooliest Minecrafter there is.

Isolated Isle
å­¤å²›

by Vertex Creations & AliceHowlter
ä½œè€…ï¼šVertex Creations & AliceHowlter


https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1Ni4y1b7R9/
Isolated Isle (the Realms map releasing today, not what I call my socially-distanced home workspace) is all about collecting raft-making materials in order to escape a tropical isle. You might think that this is the kind of environment that youâ€™d want to be stuck in, but stay there will be complicated by hordes of nocturnal baddies intent on destroying you and your raft. Clever tweaks to crafting, enchanting, and more will breathe some new life into the classic survival formula. So go bang some coconuts together, eat a parrot, and do your best to quickly escape the island!
